description.narrative: - Provision of modern business infrastructure: As only 3 hotels carry an international brand in Addis Ababa, the Project will increase the availability of hotel rooms of international standards and stimulate competition in the hospitality industry, particularly in the branded segment. -Migration of best practice: The Project will benefit from (i) the transfer by IHG of its extensive global hotel management expertise to the locally recruited staff through training and development; and (b) IFC''s support in implementing international E&S and health & safety standards. -Employment creation: The investment will create significant local direct employment for about 315 people, including approximately 20 percent of female employees, and indirect employment in the supply value chain. - Benefits to local suppliers: The Project will provide business opportunities to the local suppliers during and after project implementation, particularly in the areas of food & beverages supply and the provision of services (for example, transportation, security services). - Increased tax revenues: The Project will generate tax revenue to the Government of Ethiopia

The Project consists of the construction and operation of a greenfield 210-key, 11-storey business hotel in Addis Ababa (Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia). Upon completion, the Project will be branded Crowne Plaza hotel under a full management contract with International Hotels Group (IHG). The purpose of this investment is to help to address the shortage of hotel rooms of international standards in the capital city Addis-Ababa.
